CVE-2011-1865.title: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1865.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP OpenView Storage Data Protector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 5555 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Nahuel C. Riva and Oren Isacson of Core Security Technologies reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-1865.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2011-1866.title: HP OpenView Storage Data Protector Stack Overflows Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1866.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in HP OpenView Storage Data Protector. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 5555 to trigger a stack overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system.Nahuel C. Riva and Oren Isacson of Core Security Technologies reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-1866.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2011-1867.title: HP Intelligent Management Center UAM and EAD Buffer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1867.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Intelligent Management Center User Access Manager (UAM) and Endpoint Admission Defense (EAD). A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to TCP port 9090 to trigger a buffer overflow in 'iNOdeMngChecker.exe' and execute arbitrary code. The code will run with the privileges of the target service (System privileges on Windows-based systems).The vendor was notified on January 21, 2011.Luigi Auriemma reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2011-1867.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2011-1868.title: Microsoft Distributed File System Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1868.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Distributed File System. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted Distributed File System (DFS) response in response to a DFS client request to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-1868]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A remote user can send specially crafted DFS referral responses to cause the target system to stop responding until manually restarted [CVE-2011-1869]. Laurent Gaffie of NGS Software reported this vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-1868.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2011-1869.title: Microsoft Distributed File System Bugs Let Remote Users Deny Service and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1869.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Microsoft Distributed File System. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a specially crafted Distributed File System (DFS) response in response to a DFS client request to execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-1868]. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.A remote user can send specially crafted DFS referral responses to cause the target system to stop responding until manually restarted [CVE-2011-1869]. Laurent Gaffie of NGS Software reported this vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-1869.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2011-1872.title: Microsoft Hyper-V VMBus Packet Validation Flaw Lets Local Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-1872.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Hyper-V. A local user on the guest operating system can cause denial of service conditions on the host operating system.A local user on the guest operating system can send specially crafted VMBus packets to the host to cause the host operating system to stop responding.Nicolas Economou of Core Security Technologies reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1872.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can cause the target host system to stop responding.

CVE-2011-1873.title: Windows Kernel Memory Corruption Error in Win32k.sys Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1873.body: A vulnerability was reported in Windows Win32k.sys. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted OpenType font file on a network share. When the target user visits the network share (or a web site that points to the network share), a memory corruption error in 'Win32k.sys' will occur and arbitrary code will be executed on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Koro of www.korosoft.net reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1873.extra: A remote user can create a file on a network share that, when visited by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2011-1874.title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-1874.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in the Windows Kernel-mode Driver (win32k.sys). A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can read kernel memory.A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a use-after-free on kernel-mode driver objects to execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-1874, CVE-2011-1875, CVE-2011-1876, CVE-2011-1877, CVE-2011-1878, CVE-2011-1879, CVE-2011-1882, CVE-2011-1883, CVE-2011-1884].A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a null-pointer dereference and execute arbitrary commands on the target system with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-1880, CVE-2011-1881, CVE-2011-1885, CVE-2011-1887, CVE-2011-1888].Tarjei Mandt of Norman reported these privilege escalation vulnerabilities.A local user can run a specially crafted program to trigger a null-pointer dereference and read kernel memory contents, including the Security Account Manager (SAM) database [CVE-2011-1886].Mr. Liang Yin, Prof. Sihan Qing and Weiping Wen, and Mr. Husheng Zhou, Department of Information Security, Beijing University, reported this information disclosure vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1874.extra: A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A local user can read kernel memory.

CVE-2011-1889.title: Microsoft Forefront Threat Management Gateway Bounds Validation Flaw in Winsock Provider Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1889.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Forefront Threat Management Gateway Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.The client does not properly validate user-supplied data to the NSPLookupServiceNext() function. A remote user that can cause the target user to generate specific requests can trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.
CVE-2011-1889.extra: A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.

CVE-2011-1894.title: Microsoft MHTML Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-1894.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft MHTML. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML containing the <EMBED> tag that, when loaded by a target user, will trigger a flaw in the MHTML protocol handler and cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2011-1894.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Windows DLL (Any) software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-1899.title: CA eHealth Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-1899.body: A vulnerability was reported in CA eHealth. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can create a specially crafted URL that, when loaded by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the CA eHealth software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The "Scan user input for potentially malicious HTML content" configuration option does not protect against this vulnerability.Tony Fogarty reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1899.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the CA eHealth software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-1907.title: BIND RPZ Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-1907.body: A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted queries of type RRSIG to cause the target service to crash.Name servers using a response policy zone (RPZ) configured for RRset replacement are affected.Mitsuru Shimamura at Internet Initiative Japan reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1907.extra: A remote user can cause the target service to crash.

CVE-2011-1910.title: BIND RRSIG RRsets Negative Caching Off-by-one Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-1910.body: A vulnerability was reported in BIND. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote DNS server can supply very large RRSIG RRsets in a negative response to trigger an off-by-one error in a buffer size check and cause the target requesting named process to crash.
CVE-2011-1910.extra: A remote user can cause named to crash.

CVE-2011-1921.title: Subversion mod_dav_svn May Disclose Unreadable Files to Remote Users in Certain Cases
CVE-2011-1921.body: A vulnerability was reported in Subversion. A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive file contents.In some cases, mod_dav_svn generate incorrect resource URLs when performing access control subrequests. As a result, a remote user can submit a request via mod_dav_svn's "replay" REPORT mechanism that may disclose restrict file contents in certain cases.Files and directories that are configured to be unreadable but are children (immediate or otherwise) of a readable directory that was copied or moved from an unreadable path are affected.Kamesh Jayachandran, CollabNet, Inc., reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1921.extra: A remote user can obtain potentially sensitive file contents.

CVE-2011-1926.title: Cyrus IMAP Server STARTTLS Buffer Flushing Flaw Lets Remote Users Inject Commands via Man-in-the-Middle Attacks
CVE-2011-1926.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cyrus IMAP Server. A remote user can inject commands.The server does not flush the received commands buffer after switching to TLS encryption for IMAP, LMTP, NNTP, and POP3 sessions. A remote user can conduct a man-in-the-middle attack to inject commands and gain access to the target user's mail credentials or mail.
CVE-2011-1926.extra: A remote user can gain access to the target user's mail credentials or mail.

CVE-2011-1937.title: Webmin Unescaped Full Name Value Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-1937.body: A vulnerability was reported in Webmin. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input in the user's full name before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Webmin software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.Javier Bassi reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-1937.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Webmin software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-1947.title: Fetchmail STARTTLS Blocking IO Bug Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-1947.body: A vulnerability was reported in Fetchmail. A remote authenticated user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote authenticated server can fail to respond to a STARTTLS or STLS request to cause the target connected client application to hang indefinitely.SSL-wrapped mode on dedicated ports is not affected.
CVE-2011-1947.extra: A remote authenticated server can cause denial of service conditions.

CVE-2011-1983.title: Microsoft Office Use-After-Free Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-1983.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Office. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted Word file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a use-after-free memory error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Nikita Tarakanov (CISS Research Team) and Alexey Sintsov (Digital Security Research Group) reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2011-1983.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2011-2002.title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2002.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a null pointer dereference in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on 32-bit operating systems [CVE-2011-1985].A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when processed by the target user via the Windows Explorer Details and Previews pane, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart [CVE-2011-2002].A remote user can create a specially crafted '.fon' font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2003].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a use-after-free memory error in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2011].Andrei Lutas of BitDefender, Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Maik Wellmann, and Will Dorman of the CERT/CC reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2002.extra: A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can gain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.

CVE-2011-2003.title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2003.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a null pointer dereference in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on 32-bit operating systems [CVE-2011-1985].A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when processed by the target user via the Windows Explorer Details and Previews pane, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart [CVE-2011-2002].A remote user can create a specially crafted '.fon' font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2003].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a use-after-free memory error in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2011].Andrei Lutas of BitDefender, Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Maik Wellmann, and Will Dorman of the CERT/CC reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2003.extra: A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can gain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.

CVE-2011-2011.title: Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers Memory Corruption Errors Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Deny Service and Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2011.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Windows Kernel-Mode Drivers. A remote user cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can gain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can cause denial of service conditions.A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a null pointer dereference in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges on 32-bit operating systems [CVE-2011-1985].A remote user can create a specially crafted TrueType font file that, when processed by the target user via the Windows Explorer Details and Previews pane, will cause the target system to stop responding and restart [CVE-2011-2002].A remote user can create a specially crafted '.fon' font file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2003].A local user can run a specially crafted application to trigger a use-after-free memory error in Win32k.sys and execute arbitrary code with kernel level privileges [CVE-2011-2011].Andrei Lutas of BitDefender, Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Maik Wellmann, and Will Dorman of the CERT/CC reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2011.extra: A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can gain kernel level privileges on the target system.A local user can cause the target system to stop responding and restart.

CVE-2011-2013.title: Windows TCP/IP Stack Integer Overflow Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2013.body: A vulnerability was reported in the Windows TCP/IP Stack. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a continuous flow of specially crafted UDP packets to a closed port on the target system to trigger an integer overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with kernel level privileges.
CVE-2011-2013.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system with kernel level privileges.

CVE-2011-2014.title: Microsoft Active Directory CRL Validation Flaw Lets Remote Users Bypass Authentication
CVE-2011-2014.body: A vulnerability was reported in Microsoft Active Directory. A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system in certain cases.The software does not properly validate certificates against the certificate revocation list (CRL). A remote user with access to a previously revoked certificate can authenticate to the associated Active Directory domain and gain access to network resources or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the certificate's user.Active Directory Application Mode (ADAM) and Active Directory Lightweight Directory Service (AD LDS) are also affected.Xavier Lassoie and Sebastien Godard of Autosecurite reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-2014.extra: A remote user can bypass authentication on the target system in certain cases.

CVE-2011-2023.title: SquirrelMail Input Validation Flaw in Style Tag Attributes Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-2023.body: A vulnerability was reported in SquirrelMail. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can send style tags with specially crafted attributes that, when viewed by a target user, will cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the SquirrelMail software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.
CVE-2011-2023.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the SquirrelMail software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-2039.title: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2039.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the installation helper applet or ActiveX control to install arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2011-2039, CVE-2011-2040]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsy00904 (for Windows) and CSCsy05934 (for Linux and Mac OS X) to this vulnerability.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A local user can enable the Start Before Logon (SBL) feature and then interact with the client in the Windows logon screen to gain LocalSystem privileges [CVE-2011-2041].Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta40556 to this vulnerability.A customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
CVE-2011-2039.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will install and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2011-2040.title: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2040.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the installation helper applet or ActiveX control to install arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2011-2039, CVE-2011-2040]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsy00904 (for Windows) and CSCsy05934 (for Linux and Mac OS X) to this vulnerability.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A local user can enable the Start Before Logon (SBL) feature and then interact with the client in the Windows logon screen to gain LocalSystem privileges [CVE-2011-2041].Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta40556 to this vulnerability.A customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
CVE-2011-2040.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will install and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2011-2041.title: Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code and Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2041.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will cause the installation helper applet or ActiveX control to install arbitrary code on the target user's system [CVE-2011-2039, CVE-2011-2040]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug IDs CSCsy00904 (for Windows) and CSCsy05934 (for Linux and Mac OS X) to this vulnerability.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability via iDefense.A local user can enable the Start Before Logon (SBL) feature and then interact with the client in the Windows logon screen to gain LocalSystem privileges [CVE-2011-2041].Cisco has assigned Cisco Bug ID CSCta40556 to this vulnerability.A customer reported this vulnerability to Cisco.
CVE-2011-2041.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will install and execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system.

CVE-2011-2064.title: Cisco Content Services Gateway ICMP Processing Flaw Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-2064.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Content Services Gateway. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send a series of specially crafted ICMP packets to cause the target device to reload.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl79577 to this vulnerability.Only the second generation of Cisco Content Services Gateway is affected. The first generation is not affected.
CVE-2011-2064.extra: A remote user can cause the target device to reload.

CVE-2011-2072.title: Cisco Unified Communications Manager SIP Processing Memory Leak Lets Remote Users Interrupt Voice Services
CVE-2011-2072.body: A vulnerability was reported in Cisco Unified Communications Manager. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can send specially crafted Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) messages to trigger a memory leak and cause voice services to be interrupted.Cisco has assigned Cisco bug ID CSCtl86047 to this vulnerability.Version 4.x is not affected.Cisco IOS is also affected.
CVE-2011-2072.extra: A remote user can interrupt voice services.

CVE-2011-2092.title: Adobe LiveCycle Lets Remote Users Deny Service
CVE-2011-2092.body: Two vulnerabilities were reported in Adobe LiveCycle. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. The impact of one vulnerability was not specified.A user can exploit a complex object graph vulnerability to cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2011-2093].A user can create an unrestricted class during AMF/AMFX deserialization [CVE-2011-2092].Wouter Coekaerts reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2092.extra: A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.The impact of the other vulnerability was not specified.

CVE-2011-2094.title: Adobe Acrobat/Reader Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Security, Deny Service, and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2094.body: Multiple vulnerabilities reported in Adobe Acrobat/Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass a security function.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2094, CVE-2011-2095, CVE-2011-2096, CVE-2011-2097, CVE-2011-2098, CVE-2011-2099, CVE-2011-2103 (version 8.x only), CVE-2011-2105, CVE-2011-2106 (Mac OS X only)]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). In certain cases, the application may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2011-2100]. This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will cause scripting code to run in the context of a different domain and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2011-2101].A remote user can bypass security [CVE-2011-2102]. This vulnerability only affects Adobe Reader and Acrobat X.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2011-2104].The following product versions are affected:Adobe Reader X (10.0.1) and earlier 10.x versions for WindowsAdobe Reader X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for MacintoshAdobe Reader 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Reader 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAn anonymous reporter (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Secunia Research, Rodrigo Rubira Branco, Mila Parkour, Billy Rios from the Google Security Team, Christian Navarrete of CubilFelino Security Research Lab, Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team, Brett Gervasoni of Sense of Security, Will Dormann of CERT, and James Quirk of Los Alamos, New Mexico reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2094.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can bypass a security function.

This vulnerability only affects Adobe Reader and Acrobat X.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2011-2104].The following product versions are affected:Adobe Reader X (10.0.1) and earlier 10.x versions for WindowsAdobe Reader X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for MacintoshAdobe Reader 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Reader 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAn anonymous reporter (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Secunia Research, Rodrigo Rubira Branco, Mila Parkour, Billy Rios from the Google Security Team, Christian Navarrete of CubilFelino Security Research Lab, Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team, Brett Gervasoni of Sense of Security, Will Dormann of CERT, and James Quirk of Los Alamos, New Mexico reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2105.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can bypass a security function.

CVE-2011-2106.title: Adobe Acrobat/Reader Multiple Bugs Let Remote Users Bypass Security, Deny Service, and Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2106.body: Multiple vulnerabilities reported in Adobe Acrobat/Reader. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system. A remote user can cause denial of service conditions. A remote user can bypass a security function.A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a buffer overflow or memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system [CVE-2011-2094, CVE-2011-2095, CVE-2011-2096, CVE-2011-2097, CVE-2011-2098, CVE-2011-2099, CVE-2011-2103 (version 8.x only), CVE-2011-2105, CVE-2011-2106 (Mac OS X only)]. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A remote user can create a specially crafted DLL file on a remote share (e.g., WebDAV, SMB share). In certain cases, the application may load the remote user's DLL instead of the intended DLL and execute arbitrary code [CVE-2011-2100]. This type of exploit is also known as "binary planting" or "DLL preloading".A remote user can create a specially crafted file that, when loaded by the target user, will cause scripting code to run in the context of a different domain and potentially execute arbitrary code [CVE-2011-2101].A remote user can bypass security [CVE-2011-2102]. This vulnerability only affects Adobe Reader and Acrobat X.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions [CVE-2011-2104].The following product versions are affected:Adobe Reader X (10.0.1) and earlier 10.x versions for WindowsAdobe Reader X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for MacintoshAdobe Reader 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Reader 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat X (10.0.3) and earlier 10.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 9.4.4 and earlier 9.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAdobe Acrobat 8.2.6 and earlier 8.x versions for Windows and MacintoshAn anonymous reporter (via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative), Tarjei Mandt of Norman, Secunia Research, Rodrigo Rubira Branco, Mila Parkour, Billy Rios from the Google Security Team, Christian Navarrete of CubilFelino Security Research Lab, Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team, Brett Gervasoni of Sense of Security, Will Dormann of CERT, and James Quirk of Los Alamos, New Mexico reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2106.extra: A remote user can create a file that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.A remote user can cause denial of service conditions.A remote user can bypass a security function.

CVE-2011-2107.title: Adobe Flash Player Input Validation Hole Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-2107.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will run in the security context of an arbitrary site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.This vulnerability is being actively exploited in targeted cases.[Editor's note: The vendor is working to determine if Adobe Reader is also affected.]
CVE-2011-2107.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with an arbitrary site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-2110.title: Adobe Flash Player Bug Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2110.body: A vulnerability was reported in Adobe Flash Player. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.This vulnerability is being actively exploited via targeted web pages.
CVE-2011-2110.extra: A remote user can create Flash content that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2011-2145.title: VMware Bugs in 'mount.vmhgfs' Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2145.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in VMware. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can exploit flaws in the VMware Host Guest File System (HGFS). VMware Workstation, Player, Fusion, ESX, and ESXi are affected. Windows-based guest operating systems are not affected.A local user on the guest operating system can mount arbitrary directories in the guest filesystem and, if the user can control the contents of the mounted directory, obtain elevated privileges on the guest operating system [CVE-2011-1787].A local user on the guest operating system can determine if a file path exists on the Host operating system and determine if it is a file or directory [CVE-2011-2146].A local user on the guest operating system can gain write access to arbitrary files in the guest filesystem [CVE-2011-2145]. Only Solaris and FreeBSD guest operating systems are affected.Dan Rosenberg reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2145.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.

CVE-2011-2146.title: VMware Bugs in 'mount.vmhgfs' Let Local Users Gain Elevated Privileges
CVE-2011-2146.body: Several vulnerabilities were reported in VMware. A local user can obtain elevated privileges on the target system. A local user can obtain potentially sensitive information.A local user can exploit flaws in the VMware Host Guest File System (HGFS). VMware Workstation, Player, Fusion, ESX, and ESXi are affected. Windows-based guest operating systems are not affected.A local user on the guest operating system can mount arbitrary directories in the guest filesystem and, if the user can control the contents of the mounted directory, obtain elevated privileges on the guest operating system [CVE-2011-1787].A local user on the guest operating system can determine if a file path exists on the Host operating system and determine if it is a file or directory [CVE-2011-2146].A local user on the guest operating system can gain write access to arbitrary files in the guest filesystem [CVE-2011-2145]. Only Solaris and FreeBSD guest operating systems are affected.Dan Rosenberg reported these vulnerabilities.
CVE-2011-2146.extra: A local user on the guest operating system can obtain elevated privileges on the target guest operating system.

CVE-2011-2176.title: GNOME NetworkManager Lets Local Users Bypass PolicyKit Settings
CVE-2011-2176.body: A vulnerability was reported in GNOME NetworkManager. A local user can bypass PolicyKit settings.The software does not properly enforce the PolicyKit 'auth_admin' action element settings when the 'auth_admin' element is specified in org.freedesktop.network-manager-settings.system.wifi.share.open action.A local user can setup a non-secure Ad-Hoc wireless network.
CVE-2011-2176.extra: A local user can bypass PolicyKit settings.

CVE-2011-2202.title: PHP File Upload Bug May Let Remote Users Overwrite Files on the Target System
CVE-2011-2202.body: A vulnerability was reported in PHP. A remote user may be able to overwrite files on the target system.PHP dos not properly filter user-supplied file path names when filling the $_FILES[] array. A remote user can submit a specially crafted multipart/form-data form to cause the target server to overwrite an arbitrary file in the root directory of the server with the privileges of the web service.Krzysztof Kotowicz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-2202.extra: A remote user can overwrite files in the root directory with the privileges of the target web service.

CVE-2011-2204.title: Apache Tomcat Discloses Passwords to Local Users in Certain Cases
CVE-2011-2204.body: A vulnerability was reported in Apache Tomcat. A local user can view user passwords.When an exception occurs while creating users via JMX and using the MemoryUserDatabase (based on tomcat-users.xml), the system will write the user's password to a log file. A local user may be able to view the password without having the requisite administrative privileges.Polina Genova reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-2204.extra: A local user can view user passwords.

CVE-2011-2217.title: VMware VI Client ActiveX Control Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2217.body: A vulnerability was reported in the VMware VI Client. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create a specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will invoke an ActiveX control and trigger memory corruption errors to potentially execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.Elazar Broad reported this vulnerability via iDefense.
CVE-2011-2217.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.

CVE-2011-2220.title: Novell File Reporter RECORD Tag Parsing Error Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2220.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell File Reporter. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send a specially crafted RECORD tag to 'NFREngine.exe' via HTTPS on TCP port 3035 trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with System privileges.The vendor was notified on May 25, 2011.gwslabs.com reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2011-2220.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2011-2227.title: Novell Identity Manager Roles Based Provisioning Module Input Validation Flaw in 'apwaDetailId' Permits Cross-Site Scripting Attacks
CVE-2011-2227.body: A vulnerability was reported in Novell Identity Manager Roles Based Provisioning Module. A remote user can conduct cross-site scripting attacks.The software does not properly filter HTML code from user-supplied input before displaying the input. A remote user can cause arbitrary scripting code to be executed by the target user's browser. The code will originate from the site running the Novell Identity Manager software and will run in the security context of that site. As a result, the code will be able to access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.The apwaDetailId parameters are affected.
CVE-2011-2227.extra: A remote user can access the target user's cookies (including authentication cookies), if any, associated with the site running the Novell Identity Manager software, access data recently submitted by the target user via web form to the site, or take actions on the site acting as the target user.

CVE-2011-2331.title: HP Intelligent Management Center Heap Overflow in 'img.exe' Lets Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2331.body: A vulnerability was reported in HP Intelligent Management Center. A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.A remote user can send specially crafted data to 'img.exe' on TCP port 8800 to trigger a heap overflow and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target service.The original advisory is available at:http://www.zerodayinitiative.com/advisories/ZDI-11-170The vendor was notified on December 1, 2010.Luigi Auriemma reported this vulnerability via TippingPoint's Zero Day Initiative.
CVE-2011-2331.extra: A remote user can execute arbitrary code on the target system.

CVE-2011-2345.title: Google Chrome Multiple Flaws Let Remote Users Execute Arbitrary Code
CVE-2011-2345.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in Google Chrome. A remote user can cause arbitrary code to be executed on the target user's system.A remote user can create specially crafted HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will trigger a memory corruption error and execute arbitrary code on the target system. The code will run with the privileges of the target user.A specially crafted NPAPI string can trigger an out-of-bounds read [CVE-2011-2345]. Philippe Arteau reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted SVG font can trigger a use-after-free [CVE-2011-2346]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.Specially crafted CSS can trigger memory corruption [CVE-2011-2347]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.Certain lifetime and re-entrancy issues exist in the HTML parser [CVE-2011-2350]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.Bounds checking errors exist in the v8 JavaScript engine [CVE-2011-2348]. Aki Helin of OUSPG reported this vulnerability.A specially crafted SVG use element can trigger a use-after-free [CVE-2011-2351]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.Text selection can trigger a use-after-free [CVE-2011-2349]. miaubiz reported this vulnerability.
CVE-2011-2345.extra: A remote user can create HTML that, when loaded by the target user, will execute arbitrary code on the target user's system.
